channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Student Fall ’24/Spring ’25 Parking Permits Available as of August 1
item.description: Student parking permits for the Fall ’24/Spring ’25 semesters will be available for sale beginning Thursday, August 1. Please note that first-year students are not allowed to have a vehicle on campus, and all other students must register and have a valid permit before parking on campus. For additional information, please contact the Parking office by phone at (518) 276-6616 or via email.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer, Hokkaido University Sign Letter of Intent for Semiconductor Collaboration
item.description: On Tuesday, August 20, Rensselaer and Hokkaido University of Japan announced their plan to explore collaborative opportunities in semiconductor education and research contributing to semiconductor workforce development initiatives. The two universities recognized the new partnership with a letter of intent signing ceremony, with representatives from the Hokkaido Prefecture government, the Japanese semiconductor company Rapidus, IBM, NY CREATES, and RPI faculty and students in attendance.
item.author: Community

item.title: BME Weinbaum Lecture to be Held August 29
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 29, 2024 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - In his talk “Bioengineering Hydrogels for Regenerative Medicine,” Andr�s J. Garc�a, Ph.D., Executive Director at the Petit Institute for Bioengineering and Bioscience Regents’ Professor in the Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering at Georgia Tech, will discuss how hydrogels have emerged as powerful synthetic analogs of extracellular matrices for basic cell studies, as well as promising biomaterials for regenerative medicine applications.
item.author: Community

item.title: Guided Tour of Downtown Troy Scheduled for August 28
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:30 PM - All members of the campus community are welcome to start off the new semester with a tour of downtown Troy. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Games and Animation Programs Earn Top Industry Certification
item.description: The Games and Simulation Arts and Sciences program and the Department of Arts in Rensselaer’s School of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences have earned certification from SideFX as a Houdini Certified School Partner. This comes at an exciting time for animation and game design at RPI; Rensselaer was recently named among the top 25 game design programs in the nation and third in New York State, and placed in the East Coast’s top 20 animation schools and the nation’s top 20 game design schools.
item.author: Community

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgraded to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. This is the final upgrade prior to the start of the semester, and brings in increased stability and features for utilizing Webex within a course in Blackboard. Please refer to the ITSSC Knowledge Base for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgrades to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. This is the final upgrade prior to the start of the semester, and brings in increased stability and features for utilizing Webex within a course in Blackboard. Please refer to the ITSSC Knowledge Base [https://itssc.rpi.edu/hc/en-us/sections/360008224951] for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: HelioCampus Syllabus Assistance Available in August
item.description: HelioCampus syllabus assistance will be available during in-person office hours with Amy Svirsky, Learning Assessment Specialist, on August 15, 22, and 26.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: TIAA Holding In-Person Confidential Retirement Counseling September 5
item.description:
Date: Thursday, September 5, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
